transportAdvice: Edinburgh's compact Old Town and New Town are very walkable for most tourist attractions, with the Royal Mile and Princes Street easily covered on foot. The city also has a bus network and a tram line connecting the airport to the city centre, and taxis are readily available throughout.

weather.description: Cold and frequently wet with short daylight hours, occasional frost and wind make it feel colder than the thermometer suggests.
Still cold and grey with persistent rain and wind, though daylight begins to noticeably lengthen toward month's end.
Early spring brings slightly milder temperatures but changeable conditions with a mix of sunshine and showers.
Pleasantly mild with longer days and occasional sunny spells, though cool winds and showers remain common.
One of the more agreeable months with brighter skies and comfortable temperatures, though a jacket is still advisable.
Warm and bright with very long days, though rain is never far away and evenings can still be cool.
The warmest month and peak festival season, with long daylight hours but a reliable chance of showers throughout.
Warm and lively during the famous August festivals, with similar conditions to July including mixed sunshine and rain.
Early autumn brings cooler temperatures and shorter days, with a pleasant crispness and occasional golden sunny spells.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn deepens, with strong winds and frequent overcast skies.
Cold and damp with limited daylight, rain and wind are frequent and temperatures can drop sharply at night.
Cold and often wet with the shortest days of the year, though festive markets and Hogmanay celebrations add seasonal charm.
